spaceanswers.com/2015/01/when-was-polari.snippet: Polaris is the northern hemisphere's Pole Star all of the stars in the northern sky appear to circle it. Image Credit: Ted Quackenbush. Asked by Anna Weston. Polaris was first catalogued in 169 AD by Claudius Ptolemy.
